docs.lead_paragraph: The Mayor's reorganization of the Surgical Department of Police is not hailed by the Police as the wisest of moves. The Post says "it is as absurd to appoint special medical officers to prescribe for them as it would be to appoint a set of doctors to see that the bowels of the Aldermen are in proper order, or commission one of the Faculty as body physician to the Mayor.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Surgeons for the Police-The Mayor's Project.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor WOOD's plan of reorganizing the Surgical Department of the Police is to-day officially promulgated. It reads like a "general order." The Mayor has discovered the great mistake he made on the occasion of the late review, when he fell into the error of supposing that the police were doctored gratuitously because there were doctors in the department.

docs.lead_paragraph: Brooklyn Public Schools. Of all the great material interests connected with the growth and prosperity of our sister city there is no one in which the whole people so directly participate, and yet of which they have so little positive knowledge, as the system of public education. docs.lead_paragraph: Capt. CAMPBELL, of the brig Fannie, from Matanzas, arrived on Saturday, informs us the weather had been very fine, the health of the place good, and no sickness. There had been rain in the interior, which was very favorable for the growing cane. The prospects for the next crop are very good. Sugars very dear, with a small stock on hand. Molasses exceedingly searce and held at high rates.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mortality in Brooklyn. The Health Officer reports eighty-eight deaths, as having occurred during the week, ending the 7th inst., from the following DISEASES.-Abscess brain, atrophy, bronchitis, casualty, bilious cholia, conscious of the brain, croup, dropsy in the abdomen billed fever, inflammation of the bowels, inflammation of the lungs, killed, premature births, sun-stroke, ulcers of intestines, unknown-1 each. ticuKe, uac rr o lutoestines, unnbiown-I each. docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN MINNIE and AUGUSTUS JOHNSON were on Friday morning brought before Justice OSBORN, charged with having dealings and transacting business with vessels lying at Quarantine, contrary to the provisions of the Quarantine laws.
